info.title: WCM API
info.description:
The API design for version 2.0 of the DX REST API intended to facilitate the management of Web content. 

Most of the APIs are intended for CRUD operations of the different artifacts supported by WCM. An additional path added for some of the artifacts supports the rendering of these artifacts. The rendering APIs are denoted by the /render-info/* URL prefix. 

In case virtual Portals are used the virtual Portal can be specified by adding the query parameter ?virtualPortal to the URL of the API explorer with the value of the virtual Portal URL context - for example http://localhost:10039/dx/api/wcm/v2/explorer/?virtualPortal=myVirtualPortalContext  - all API calls will then have the virtual Portal context included in the URL. If you are using host based virtual Portals access the API explorer with the virtual Portal host..

Note that most of the API examples contains xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx which is actually a placeholder for an item UUID. Replace it with actual item UUID wherever required.

/contents/analysis.summary: Send Content for AI analysis of Sentiment, keywords, summarization
/contents/analysis.description:
# Sentiment Analysis

Sentiment analysis is a branch of natural language processing (NLP) that involves the use of computational techniques to identify,  extract, and quantify subjective information from text data. It involves analyzing written or spoken language to determine the emotional of a piece of text, such as a tweet, review, or news article.

    The possible sentiments would be one of the 5 sentiments mentioned below: 
    * Highly Negative 
    * Negative 
    * Neutral 
    * Positive 
    * Highly Positive
    
### Constraint : 
    The api is currently uses the  512 tokens from the input text rest are ignored. This will be handled in the next versions
    
### Supported Languages : 
    This Sentiment Model supports six languges  (English, Dutch, German, French, Spanish and Italian)

# Keywords Generation

This API will be used to extract keyphrases for a given text. Keyphrase
    extraction (also known as keyphrase detection or keyphrase analysis) is a
    text analysis technique that automatically extracts the most used and most
    important phrases from a text.
    
    Supported Languages :The Keyphrase Extraction API  supports six
    languges - English, Dutch, German, French, Spanish and Italian.

# Summary Generation

Document summarization uses natural language processing techniques to generate a summary for documents. There are two general approaches to automatic summarization, both of which are supported by the API: extractive and abstractive.

    
    Extractive summarization extracts sentences that collectively represent the
    most important or relevant information within the original content.
    Abstractive summarization generates a summary with concise, coherent
    sentences or words which are not simply extract sentences from the original
    document. These features are designed to shorten content that could be
    considered too long to read.

    
`1.`**`Abstractive summarization`**: 
    
    
    Generates a summary that may not use the same words as those in the document, but captures the main idea.
    
    
`2.`**`Extractive summarization`**: 
    
    
    Produces a summary by extracting salient sentences within the document
    
    
### Supported Languages
    
    `english`, `french`, `spanish`, `german`, `italian`, `dutch`, `amharic`, `arabic`, `azerbaijani`, `bengali`, `burmese`, `chinese_simplified`, `chinese_traditional`, `gujarati`, `hausa`, `hindi`, `igbo`, `indonesian`, `japanese`, `kirundi`, `korean`, `kyrgyz`, `marathi`, `nepali`, `oromo`, `pashto`, `persian`, `pidgin`, `portuguese`, `punjabi`, `russian`, `scottish_gaelic`, `serbian_cyrillic`, `serbian_latin`, `sinhala`, `somali`, `swahili`, `tamil`, `telugu`, `thai`, `tigrinya`, `turkish`, `ukrainian`, `urdu`, `uzbek`, `vietnamese`, `welsh`, `yoruba`

parameters.name: sentimentElement
parameters.description: Optional parameter to indicate which field will be sent for sentiment analysis. If not present, it will do overall sentiment.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Optional parameter that will indicate the type of analysis to be done. If not present, will process all types.

200.description: Returns content with generated description, keywords and sentiment.

403.description: The user is authenticated but does not have the correct permissions to complete the request

post.description: Send content for AI analysis, including sentiment analysis, keyword extraction, and summarization.

/categories.description: The get method returns a collection of taxonomies and categories. The results can be scoped to specific libraries using the libraryID query string, the default is all libraries. In addition type allows the user to retrieve either categories, taxonomies or both. The default is both types are returned. The post method provides the ability to create a taxonomy or category.

parameters.name: libraryID
parameters.description: Specifying one or more library ids will limit the results to the specified library, defaults to all libraries.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type can either be taxonomy or category, defaults to both.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset and limit parameters can be leveraged to limit the results - offset is the starting point from which results will be returned.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The offset and limit parameters can be leveraged to limit the results - limit is the number of results which will be returned.

200.description: Successfully returns a collection of taxonomies and categories.

403.description: The user is authenticated but does not have the correct permissions to complete the request

get.description: Retrieve taxonomies and categories. Use the 'libraryID' parameter to limit the results to one or more libraries, and the 'type' parameter to specify categories or taxonomies.

requestBody.description: The category to be created. The 'id' is automatically generated and should not be included in the request. Including an 'id' will result in a bad request.

201.description: Successfully returns the newly created category.

403.description: The user is authenticated but does not have the correct permissions to complete the request

post.description: Create a category or taxonomy. The 'id' is automatically generated and should not be included in the request. Including an 'id' will result in an error.

/categories/{category_taxonomy_id}.description: Methods include get to retrieve a taxonomy or category, use version as a query string to retrieve a specific version. Put to update a taxonomy or category, delete to delete a taxonomy or category, or patch to patch or restore a version.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version id for the version of the item to return.

403.description: The user is authenticated but does not have the correct permissions to complete the request

put.summary: Update Taxonomy or Category.
put.description: Update the taxonomy or category specified by the path parameter. If the requested object is not found or is not a valid taxonomy or category, an error response will be returned.

403.description: The user is authenticated but does not have the correct permissions to complete the request

/favorite-items.summary: Retrieves the list of favorite items
/favorite-items.description:
This endpoint supports only 'GET' to retrieve the list of favorite items.
Adding and Removing of favorite items can be handled through the generic item uri (Example PUT request: /LibraryJSPComponent/{jsp_uuid}) using the following json added as part of the category:
    {
        "scheme": "wcmrest:favorite",
        "term": "true",
        "lang": "en"
    }

Note: term is true to add to favorites, false to remove from the favorites.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
This parameter is used to query items of a specific item type.
For example, to query a list of components:

/favorite-items?type=LibraryHTMLComponent

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The sort parameter is appended to queries to determine how query results are sorted. The following values can be used with the sort parameter.
- accessed
- author
- created
- modified
- name
- title

The values _ascending or _descending are appended to the query to determine sort order.
For example, to sort a presentation template query in ascending order of creation, you would use:

/favorite-items?type=PresentationTemplate&sort=created_descending

If _ascending or _descending` are not specified, the results as displayed in ascending order.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
This parameter is used with the pagesize parameter to define what set of results to display. 
For example:
/favorite-items?type=PresentationTemplate&pagesize=5&page=2

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description:
This parameter is used to restrict the number of items that are returned by a query to a set number. It can be used with the page parameter to return specific pages of results.For example, to restrict the number of queries to be returned to 5:
/favorite-items?type=PresentationTemplate&pagesize=5

the number of items that are returned by a query to a set number. It can be used with the page parameter to return specific pages of results.For example, to restrict the number of queries to be returned to 5:

/favorite-items?type=PresentationTemplate&pagesize=5

200.description: Returns the list of favorite items. Can return empty if no added favorite item.

        "term": "true",
        "lang": "en"
    }

Note: term is true to add to favorites, false to remove from the favorites.

/operations.summary: Bulk update operation to update multiple resources
/operations.description:
The POST method provides the ability to create an operation that can update multiple resources in a single operation. This endpoint now supports three operation types for bulk updates: "updateExpiry", "updateAuthors", and "updateOwners". The "updateExpiry" operation type is used to update the expiryDate of multiple resources in a single operation. Similarly, "updateAuthors" is employed to update authors, and the "updateOwners" operation type can be used to update owners of the specified resources. 

The GET method returns a collection of operations that provides the ability to track the status of existing or ongoing bulk operations.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The offset and limit parameters can be leveraged to limit the results - limit is the number of results which will be returned.

parameters.name: offset

parameters.description:

- accessed
- author

/recent-items?type=PresentationTemplate&pagesize=5

parameters.name: createdbefore
parameters.description:
This parameter is used to query items that are created before a specific date and time. For example:

parameters.name: expirebefore

This parameter is used to query items that were expired before a specific date and time. For example:
?expirebefore=2011-01-11T11:43:29.0150Z

parameters.description:
This parameter is used to filter access control roles using the WCM Query API. All other parameters like parentid or type still apply, so one can, for example, find all libraries the user has the Editor role on. Valid roles: User, Editor, Admin, Manager, Contributor. For example:
?filteraccess=Contributor

?lastmodifier=uid=WCMUT_Editor_A,o=defaultWIMFileBasedRealm

Update the status of a Subscriber specified by the path parameter. If the object is not found or is not a Subscriber, an error will be returned.
These fields can change the status of the Subscriber:
- "isEnabled": Set the enabled state of the Subscriber to either "true" or "false".

NavigatorData.title: NavigatorData
NavigatorData.description: The properties found in the data section for a Navigator component.

footerLayout.description: The markup used to display a footer. If Design Studio is enabled, markup or model information can be used.

headerLayout.description: The markup used to display a header. If Design Studio is enabled, markup or model information can be used.

noResultsLayout.description: The markup used when there are no results to display. If Design Studio is enabled, markup or model information can be used.

resultsLayout.description: The markup used to display results.If Design Studio is enabled, markup or model information can be used.

separatorLayout.description: The markup used to display a separator between results. If Design Studio is enabled, markup or model information can be used.

startType.description: The start type defines which site area is used as the initial reference point for this navigator to calculate the output rendering. Ancestors, descendants, and siblings are determined from this point in the site framework. If Design Studio is enabled, SELECTED, CURRENT_TOP_LEVEL_SITE_AREA, and CURRENT_SITE_AREA can be used when working with content-sites and content-pages (ignore the legacy naming convention that refers to site areas). SELECTED mode can be used to specify the ID of a content-site or content-page as the start point. CURRENT_TOP_LEVEL_SITE_AREA mode is an absolute setting that automatically uses the top content-site as the initial reference point. CURRENT_SITE_AREA mode is a relative setting that calculates the navigator output based on the currently rendered content-page as the initial reference point.

selectedStartArea.description: The selected start area is used in conjunction with a SELECTED start type. It defines which site area is used as the intial reference point for this navigator. It is used to specify the id of a site-area. If Design Studio is enabled, SELECTED mode can be used to specify the ID of a content-site or content-page as the start point.

includeStart.description: Specifies if the initial reference point should be included in the results.

ancestorLevel.description: Specifies depth level of ancestors. Maps to level of parents. A value of -1 indicates to use all ancestors.

descendantLevel.description: Specifies depth level of descendants. Maps to level of children. A value of -1 indicates to use all descendants.

precedingSiblingsLevel.description: Specifies depth level of siblings preceding the initial reference point. A value of -1 indicates to use all the preceding siblings. A value of -2 indicates to use the first preceding sibling.

postSiblingsLevel.description: Specifies depth level of siblings following the initial reference point. A value of -1 indicates to use all the next siblings. A value of -2 indicates to use the last post sibling.

showContent.description: Show content. If Design Studio is enabled with a SELECTED start type and a content-site/content-page id specified for selectedStartArea, this value will always be false.

expandCurrent.description: Expand current navigator branch one level

expandToCurrent.description: Expand navigator to display current site area

resultsPerPage.description: This determines the maximum number of results displayed at one time.

startPage.description: The page result that you want to display first. For example, you can display the second page result first if you type 2 in this field.

readAheadPages.description: Pages to read ahead. If you type 3, the page navigation component calculates results up to three pages ahead of the current page. Increasing this number improves the accuracy of the page navigation component. Lowering this number improves the performance of the page navigation component when rendered.

data.description: Data required for the operationType in expected format

operationType.description:
operationType is the type of bulk operation that needs to performed. Currently, the following operationType are supported:

"updateExpiry" - update expiryDate of the specified resources.
"updateAuthors" - update author of the specified resources.
"updateOwners" - update owner of the specified resources.

items.description: items contains an array of objects that would contain "endpoint", which is resource endpoint that is used to update that item type and listOfIds is the ids of the resources on which the bulk update should be applied to

action.example: "Update expiry date to Mon, 15 Jan xxxx"

criteria.example: "All Contents, Expired, From 01/01/2022, To 01/01/2023, Title: Article"

OperationsData.description:
The data field is required for the operationType in the expected format. It currently supports three operation types for bulk updates: "updateExpiry", "updateAuthors", and "updateOwners". 
The "updateExpiry" operation type is used to update the expiryDate of multiple resources in a single operation. Similarly, "updateAuthors" is employed to update authors, and the "updateOwners" operation type can be used to update owners of the specified resources.

updateExpiry.description: To update expiryDate of the specified resources.

updateAuthors.description: To update Author(s) of the specified resources.

updateOwners.description: To update Owner(s) of the specified resources

UpdateExpiry.title: UpdateExpiry
UpdateExpiry.description: Object include expiryDate in date and time format to update to.

ExpiryDate.title: ExpiryDate
ExpiryDate.description: The expiryDate for the given object.

expiryDate.description: The expiryDate to update to for this resource

UpdateAuthors.description: Object contains updateType which can be either "add" or "remove" and array of user's distinguishedName (dn) to be added or removed based on the updateType specified.

UpdateAuthorsOwners.description: Data object include updateType and users to apply the update for the specified users

updateType.description:
Define update type. Possible values are either "add" or "remove".

"add" - adds the specified users
"remove" - removes the specified users

users.description: users contains arrays of user's distinguishedName(dn) in string to either be added or removed based on the updateType specified

UpdateAuthorsOwnersUpdateType.description:
The type of update. Possible values are either "add" or "remove".

"add" - adds the specified users
"remove" - removes the specified users

updateType.description:
Define update type. Possible values are either "add" or "remove".

"add" - adds the specified users
"remove" - removes the specified users

UpdateAuthorsOwnersUsers.description:
The users to be added or removed. 
Note: distinguishedName(dn) is the only accepted value for a user that needs to be added or removed.

users.description: Define users to be added or removed. Note: distinguishedName(dn) is the only accepted value for a user that needs to be added or removed.

UpdateOwners.description: Object contains updateType which can be either "add" or "remove" and array of user's distinguishedName (dn) to be added or removed based on the updateType specified.

OperationsType.title: OperationsType
OperationsType.description:
Represents the supported operationType of the bulk update operation.

Note: Currently, multiple operationTypes in a single operation is not supported.

Items.title: Items
Items.description: Object include endpoint and listOfIds to apply the update to the specified IDs.

endpoint.description:
Enpoint of the specified resource.
Example values for different kind of resource types:
1. Content - contents
2. Content Template - content-templates
3. Category/Taxonomy - categories
4. Site Area/Site Area Templates - site-areas
5. Component(all components) - components

listOfIds.description: listOfIds contains arrays of IDs in string of specified resource endpoint to be updated

OperationsItemEndpoint.title: OperationsItemEndpoint
OperationsItemEndpoint.description:
Represents the endpoint of the resources to be updated during the bulk update operation.

Available values for different kind of resource types for updateExpiry:
1. Content - "contents"
2. Content Template - "content-templates"
3. Category/Taxonomy - "categories"
4. Site Area/Site Area Templates - "site-areas"
5. Component(all components) - "components"


In addtion to the above endpoints, here are the additional endpoints only supported for updateAuthors and updateOwners operationType:

6. Folder - "folders"
7. Portal page - "pages"
8. Project - "projects"
9. Presentation Template - "presentation-templates"
10. Segment - "segments"
11. Workflows(all workflows items/actions) - "workflows"

data.description: Data required for the operation update in expected format

The "status" operation type is used to resume a single paused bulk operation.

example.markup:
Sample Article

NewEdit

This is a content item named "Sample Article". The text displayed on this page is being referenced from a rich text element named "Body" that is stored in this content item. To edit this content item, click Edit.

 

To create a new content item, click New. Once saved, the new content item will be listed in the menu component displayed below this content item. You can edit this menu component by accessing the authoring portlet located under Applications > Content > Web Content Management and editing the menu component named "Articles List".

 

For further information on using Web Content Management and these default Web content items, go to the HCL Digital Experience Help Center: http://www-10.lotus.com/ldd/portalwiki.nsf
